data.title: Great Stop for Quick Lunch
data.text: We stopped for lunch and had the Pad Thai - it was very good, but wasn't the best I've had. The service is quick and friendly. The pricing is average. Eau Claire has A LOT of international places to dine, make sure to check them all out!

data.title: food average.
data.text: The food was average .... The Singha restaurant  just down the street has much better food and value.

data.title: Pricey but good portion sizes!
data.text: Ate there this week and the meal I got, orange chicken, was very delicious and filling.  I ended up with left overs that lasted two more meals!  The price is a little steep compared to others in the area but when you can make three meals out of it then it figured out to be about $3.50 a meal for really good orange chicken.  I will be back!

data.title: Lousey
data.text: Partner wanted a decent Thai veggie dish. I wanted a noodle dish. Mine - Chiang Mia noodles was ordered spicy. Came bland and to be frank I could not eat it. $35 later we left hungry. This is a cheap-eats student place as best as we could tell.

data.title: Delicious food in the DT
data.text: I stumbled across this place after searching for Thai food in Eau Claire and was pleasantly surprised.  It's a bit out of the way for me being downtown but it's my go-to place if I'm in the area.  Great tasting fresh food at really good prices. Great Service.

data.title: Very good
data.text: Thoroughly enjoyed everything we ordered. Chicken egg rolls were perfectly crisply and fresh and tasting. The papaya salad was good balance of sweet and spicy. Drunken noodles are always a favorite and the spicy chicken wings were crispy and juicy.

data.title: Nice place for a quick bite to eat!
data.text: Service as quick, had a couple egg rolls and they were very tasty and very fresh. If you're ever just strolling and want a quick bite. I'd recommend it.

data.title: Lunch was fantastic!
data.text: We had lunch at the rice palace. It took a little while for us to get our food but once it came, oooh la la, fantastic. I ordered number 27 Kung Pow shrimp Thai style and it was fantastic with wonderful flavor. My wife ordered a cashew shrimp dish that was also very good. We will return next time we are here.

data.title: lunch time
data.text: When we walked in it was really busy and there were a lot of messy tables.  I only saw one waitress and she looked like she was serving all the 15 tables by herself. She got a table cleaned off for us and we were seated. The menu has a lot of variety. The food took about 20 minutes to come out but everything tasted great.

data.title: One of our faves
data.text: We really enjoy rice palace. We've eaten here many times and really like the egg rolls and the basil fried rice. It has a really unique flavor you can't get anywhere else. The drunken noodles are also really great and I've tried the pho and curry as well, both good. Service is pretty no nonsense, don't expect to be catered to or pampered. Be sure to take a look at Einstein swimming in the tank at the register.

data.title: Skip this!!!
data.text: Not sure why this place is still in business. Go down the street to Singha!! Much better authentic Thai and Hmong food, and better service too!!! Pad Thai was DRENCHED in oil. Pho broth was salt and water. Totally inconsistent with their meals and portions. Never going back. Out of all Asian restaurants in Eau Claire, this one is dead last. Go to Singha, Eggroll Plus or Noodle Tea house instead. Trust me.

data.title: Fresh and Tasty
data.text: My husband and I just tried this restaurant that has been in EC for at least one year.  WOW; wished we would have stopped in sooner!  The food is wonderful; lots and lots of choices.  And you can have sauces at any spice level; regular, medium or hot.  I thought the medium was plenty spicy with just the right amount of leftover zing.  My husband tried the spicy and was loving the heat it had.  The food was plenty and very fresh and tasty.  The atmosphere is not warming or cozy yet the tables are far away enough from each other that you can have private conversations.

data.title: Bland and tasteless
data.text: My son said he enjoyed the Pho. But we found the curry to be watery, too spicy and without even the slightest flavor. The stir fry was also without flavor, the meat was dry, and everything was coated with a glutinous, brown sauce-- heavy with cornstarch. The egg roll was bland, and the wrapper was doughy. The decor is ordinary and uninviting. The staff was totally confused about the menu, and asked unnecessary questions, and gave the dishes to the wrong diners. I found nothing about Rice Palace to recommend, except maybe the Pho. You will find better food at Singha, Noodle Tea House, Egg Rolls Plus -- or my favorite: Hmong Noodle Wrap.

data.title: Not even close to Thai cooking
data.text: Hmong cooking, not Thai.  Bland and greasy.  No one finished or ate more than half their meal.  It would be better if they stuck with Hmong cuisine and cooked what they know.

data.title: Authentic and Simple
data.text: I'm an asian food lover and there are many places in town for it, but this place sets itself apart from the others. The other asian food restaurants tend to be more fancy and creative which isn't bad, but not authentic and simple. That's where it is different. The Spring Rolls are wonderful. I've made my own at home and make them really packed and in big portions, this place does it just the same. Great prices, big portions and real authentic asian food is what keeps my family and I going back.

data.title: Excellent Food
data.text: Excellent food and good service. A wide variety for a decent price. Pho Soup Fridays, half price Pho Soup. Their egg rolls are delicious

data.title: Decent food...very run down otherwise
data.text: This place is not much to look at.  It's run down, old, & cheezy. However it does seem clean.  The food was pretty decent though and for that I'd probably go back. I had Kung Pao with tofu which was spicy and slightly sweet.  DW had the udon bowl which was substantial.  So go with the expectation of good food.

data.title: Pretty Good Food
data.text: Pretty Good Food.  The menu is good and the service is average.  The decor isn't the greatest but it's still nice.

data.title: Rice Palace
data.text:
This restraurant has a new name - Rice Palace.

We decided to take the Chippewa River Trail through the old part of Eau Claire and we stumbled on this restraunt on a late Sunday morning.

Excellent food! Great atmosphere!
